actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

official_title: Urging that the policy of the United States should be that Government institutions use security measures known as cryptographic splitting, the strongest available form of data centric security, to secure sensitive and personal information for data at rest and data in motion.

summary.text: Urges that it be U.S. policy that government institutions use security measures known as cryptographic splitting to secure sensitive and personal information.

titles.title: Urging that the policy of the United States should be that Government institutions use security measures known as cryptographic splitting, the strongest available form of data centric security, to secure sensitive and personal information for data at rest and data in motion.
